content:
• Friday, April 22, 2016
  • AABA

    Bloomberg: Yahoo narrowing more than 10 offers from $4B-$8B

    • Yahoo (YHOO -0.5%) and advisers are set to spend the weekend narrowing down more than 10 first-round bids for its core business, ranging from $4B-$8B, Bloomberg reports -- with an eye to moving forward as soon as next week.
    • They'll aim for about seven finalists and plan to offer them increased access to internal docs and management.
    • The higher-end bids reportedly came from bidders who haven't spent as much time with Yahoo, which should lead to more scrutiny into the structure of the offers.
    • In addition to the known bidders (that hadn't denied reports) -- Verizon (VZ +1%), YP Holdings, TPG, and Bain/Vista Equity Partners -- one or two other strategic firms were involved.
    • Echoing earlier reports, SoftBank (OTCPK:SFTBY +3.4%) isn't in the bidding but is likely eager to talk with anyone who also wants the Yahoo Japan stake.
    • Despite the progress, a final decision is likely at least a month away.
    • Now read Yahoo Sale Could Reboot Online Ad Competition »
     
     
     
     
    | 7:14 PM | 71 Comments
  • YRD

    Yirendai chief technology officer resigns, to be entrepreneur

    • Chinese consumer-finance firm Yirendai (YRD +9.2%) says its chief technology officer, Nian Duan, resigned the post for personal reasons that appear to be a new business.
    • Yihan Fang, the company's CEO, is taking over the CTO responsibilities for the time being.
    • "We will continue to invest in technology product development and build a strong engineering team to support the strong growth momentum of our business," she said. "In the meantime, we wish all the best for Nian's future endeavor as an entrepreneur."
    • Yirendai went public in December, the last U.S.-listed technology IPO before SecureWorks began trading today. It debuted then at $10, and closed at $11.59 today.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:40 PM
  • CYH

    Community Health COO sets retirement

    • Community Health Systems (CYH +2.6%) says its president and COO David Miller is retiring as of year's end.
    • He's the company's first COO since taking that role in January 2014, but has been with the firm for 19 years. Since taking over the job, he's overseen six divisions including 198 affiliated hospitals across 29 states.
    • The company is still set to proceed with a spin-off of Quorum Health Corp., to be effective next Friday.
    • Now read Community Health: Volatile Credit Markets Are Tough For Reforming Serial Acquirers »
     
     
     
     
    | 6:25 PM | 1 Comment
  • BHC

    Valeant rises 7.9% after CEO report; receives more default notices

    • Valeant Pharmaceuticals (VRX) has received more notices of default on debt due to its 10-K delay, but says it's still on track to hit its recent target to file by April 29.
    • It's now gotten default notices under indentures governing the 5.375% notes due 2020; 6.375% notes due 2020; 7.5% notes due 2021; and 7.25% notes due 2022.
    • The notices don't accelerate any indebtedness, the company says, and it has until June 21 to cure the default, well within the company's current filing plans.
    • Shares rose 7.9% today to their highest point in two weeks after a late report that the company's talking with Perrigo's Joseph Papa to become its next CEO. They're up another 0.6% after hours.
    • Now read Valeant: Information Vacuums, Management Credibility And Investment Value »
     
     
     
     
    | 5:45 PM | 76 Comments

  • After Hours Gainers / Losers

    • Top gainers, as of 5.25 p.m.: BLOX +7.4%. RPD +6.6%. WLK +1.4%. GPN +1.4%.
    • Top losers, as of 5.25p.m.: LGCY -3.2%. COG -2.6%. NGL -2.5%. VRAY -2.0%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:39 PM | 1 Comment
  • JD

    JD.com prices $1B in debt

    • JD.com (JD -1.7%) has priced $1B in notes in a pair of tranches.
    • The Chinese online seller is offering $500M of 3.125% notes due 2021, and $500M of 3.875% notes due 2026. It's expecting net proceeds of $983.5M, to be used for general purposes.
    • The company runs with a far lower debt ratio than Amazon.com: At last report, it had total cash of $3.3B against total debt of $539M.
    • Shares are down 12.3% YTD, but have risen 24% since Feb. 9.
    • Now read JD.com: Low Valuation Justifiable »
     
     
     
     
    | 5:11 PM | 3 Comments
  • UAL

    United Continental CEO Munoz buys $1M in shares

    • United Continental (NASDAQ:UAL) chief Oscar Munoz may have bought the dip today.
    • A Form 4 filing shows that Munoz acquired 19,800 shares at $50.53 -- just over $1M worth of stock, and bringing his ownership to 163,675 shares (about $8.3M worth).
    • The stock fell 3.9% today and has dropped 12.6% over the past couple of days, after earnings showed passenger revenue/available seat mils on the decline. The company beat profit expectations.
    • Shares are up 0.4% after hours.
    • Now read New Competition Poses Challenges For United Continental »
     
     
     
     
    | 4:44 PM | 8 Comments

  • Weekly ETF Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: UNG +12.17%. AMJ +10.15%. FCG +7.9%. REMX +6.83%. VDE +6.09%.
    • Losers: VXX -5.43%. XLU -3.21%. IDU -3.05%. FXY -2.58%. BRF -2.34%.  
     
     
     
     
    | 4:30 PM | 2 Comments
  • SFTBY

    Investors call for probe into SoftBank No. 2 Arora

    • A group of SoftBank (OTCPK:SFTBY +3.1%) investors have written the boards of that company and Sprint, calling for a probe into SoftBank heir apparent Nikesh Arora over alleged conflicts of interest.
    • The investors also claimed he's overpaid and making poor investment choices. The letter, sent to the boards earlier this year, says Arora isn't just responsible for global investment activity at SoftBank -- he's also a senior adviser at private-equity firm Silver Lake.
    • "Thus, he oversees the process of identifying and pursuing potential investment opportunities in the technology sector (at SoftBank)," the letter states "This dual role has the potential to reward Silver Lake to the detriment of SoftBank."
    • Stakes in DramaFever and Housing.com have soured as well, the letter says, suggesting poor investment performance, and that $138M in pay -- making him the third-highest paid exec in the world -- is "excessive."
    • "I think my track record speaks for itself," Arora says. "Since my time at SoftBank, the last 18 months, I always strived to put the company first and I think none of the comments have any substantive bearing in fact."
     
     
     
     
    | 4:13 PM | 4 Comments
  • SWN

    Southwestern Energy easily clears lower Q1 expectations, shares +13%

    • Southwestern Energy (SWN +13.2%) surges after reporting a much narrower than expected Q1 loss that's only around a third of the size of its year-ago deficit while $579M in revenues fell 38% Y/Y but still beat analyst estimates.
    • SWN says it produced 237B cf of natural gas during Q1, including 134B cf from the Appalachia Basin and 103B cf from the Fayetteville shale formation, surpassing its prior guidance of 230B-235B cf.
    • Including the effect of hedges, SWN's average realized gas price in the quarter was $1.48/Mcf down from $2.99.
    • Now read Southwestern Energy cut to Sell at UBS on valuation
     
     
     
     
    | 3:23 PM | 4 Comments
  • GE

    Chance to buy the dip in GE about over

    • Down more than 2% not long ago, GE has rebounded to just a marginal loss in late-afternoon trade.
    • Sellers seem to have focused on a 1% Y/Y decline in organic revenue, led by a 18% fall in revenue from the oil and gas equipment business - now GE's fourth-largest segment.
    • The company, though, remains headed in the right direction, writes Johanna Bennett in Barron's. Profits are rising at a double-digit pace and there's plenty of cash to aggressively buy back stock and fund acquisitions. There's also the 2.9% dividend yield. Despite the weak top-line print today, GE affirmed full-year organic sales growth guidance of 2-4%, along with EPS of $1.45-$1.55.
    • There's also Nelson Peltz's Trian Fund which invested $2.5B in October, seeing 70% upside for the shares.
    • Now read: General Electric (GE) Jeffrey R. Immelt on Q1 2016 Results - Earnings Call Transcript (April 22)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:47 PM | 12 Comments
  • GOOG

    Alphabet -5% as bulk of analysts lower price targets

    • Alphabet (GOOG -5.2%, GOOGL -5.5%) is lower today after a Q1 miss driven by ad price declines, and nearly a dozen analysts have come in with price target declines.
    • Notably, all of those maintain Buy ratings, suggesting a valuation adjustment and some product-based catalysts ahead.
    • The lowest targets on GOOGL came from SunTrust Robinson Humphrey and Morgan Stanley, trimming to $850 from $875 and $900 respectively. GOOGL is trading at $737.49.
    • SunTrust's Bob Peck says "the bull/bear debate will center around the secular cost headwinds from mobile and programmatic TAC and the incremental core investments vs. solid ex-FX topline results, the inherent leverage of the platform and incremental cash flows.”
    • On another end of the scale, Oppenheimer trimmed its target to $958, and Credit Suisse maintained its target at $920, saying “Google continues to show signs of opex control and controlled capex as both came in below our expectations, which led to better-than-expected adjusted EBITDA.” Macquarie actually boosted its target, to $890.
    • Other cuts: Baird, to $860 from $880; FBN, to $875 from $925; B. Riley, to $875 from $930; Stifel Nicolaus, to $888 from $930; JMP, to $904 from $916; and Jefferies, to $925 from $950.
    • Now read Did Alphabet Wreck Tech? »
     
     
     
     
    | 2:45 PM | 19 Comments
  • RIG

    Transocean lands three new drillship contracts

    • Transocean (RIG +2.6%) is higher after reporting in its latest fleet status update that it had secured three new contracts for work largely in offshore Asia and Latin America.
    • RIG says it gained a three-year contract with India state-owned ONGC for its Actinia rig at a $101K dayrate, or ~$111M for the full term; also, its Deepwater Invictus will be deployed offshore Trinidad for BHP Billiton for an undisclosed term at a $350K dayrate, and a six-month contract for its Dhirubhai Deepwater KG1 rig at a dayrate of $394K.
    • RIG also says it idled a number of rigs and increased its estimated out of service days for 2016.
    • Now read Transocean: Complete fleet status as of April 21, 2016, and commentary
     
     
     
     
    | 12:58 PM | 5 Comments

  • Midday Gainers/ Losers

    • Gainers: AMD +36%. NGL +34%. LGCY +32%. SRPT +25%. EVK +24%. PARN +21%. RIGL +17%. PACB +16%. CADC +14%. GLF +13%.
    • Losers: FREE -25%. RCKY -15%. TRXC -14%. SXE -14%. LAKE -13%. HA -12%. UNXL -11%. SAM -10%. GPL -7%. YORW -9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:46 PM | 3 Comments
  • COP

    ConocoPhillips plans more wells for Alaska drill site

    • ConocoPhillips (COP +2.5%) says it plans to drill additional wells and other infrastructure to boost production at its CD5 site in the Alpine field in Alaska's National Petroleum Reserve.
    • COP estimates the cost of the new project at ~$190M and says the additional wells and infrastructure will bring the site to its full design and permit capacity.
    • The site is the first commercial oil development on Alaska Native lands within the reserve; it began producing oil in October, with first oil from the next phase of drilling expected in Q3 2017.
    • Now read Don't let ConocoPhillips' well-deserved rally fool you
     
     
     
     
    | 12:42 PM | 2 Comments
  • SAM

    52-week low for Boston Beer as craft brands guzzle market share

    • Boston Beer founder Jim Koch says the craft beer industry could hit a brick wall in the next several years as the market hits a saturation point.
    • Koch thinks the number of brewers will max out at around 10K within the next two to three years. The bad news is that mark is more than double the number of craft breweries currently in operation.
    • Yesterday, Boston Beer (SAM -10.6%) reported a 6% drop in Q1 volume due in part to the proliferation of craft breweries.
    • Shares of Boston Beer are at a 52-week low.
    • Now read the Boston Beer earnings call transcript
     
     
     
     
    | 12:36 PM
  • CMA

    Investors pressure Comerica for changes

    • Comerica (CMA +3.9%) for too long has failed to earn acceptable returns, needs to cut costs dramatically, and explore whether a sale is the best option, a number of typically publicity-shy investors tell the WSJ.
    • There's also activist fund Hudson Capital, which prefers to do its work behind the scenes, letting it be known its belief that a sale should be considered.
    • Toss in CLSA bank analyst Mike Mayo, who upgraded the stock a month ago after fielding calls from investors about forcing a sale. He's urging shareholders to speak out at the bank's annual meeting next week.
    • “I know that we must earn our right to remain independent every day,” said CEO Ralph Babb on this week's earnings call.
    • Previously: Comerica on the move on rumor of sale (April 22)
    • Now read: Comerica's (NYSE:CMA) CEO Ralph Babb on Q1 2016 Results - Earnings Call Transcript (April 19)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:36 PM
  • GLOG

    GasLog, Golar LNG upgraded to Buy at Jefferies

    • Jefferies upgrades both GasLog (GLOG +4.2%) and Golar LNG (GLNG +3.5%) to Buy from Hold, saying the companies are well positioned for an improving liquefied natural gas shipping market environment.
    • The firm cites GLOG's built-in growth and growth aspirations as well as the potential to also pursue FLNG projects; it raises its stock price target to $17 from $8 based on shares trading at 140% of estimates net asset value, in-line with the historical multiple.
    • Jefferies likes GLNG's significant spot market exposure and burgeoning FLNG business, and thinks the company is poised for an anticipated near-term increase in global LNG shipping volumes as well as potentially stronger crude oil and LNG prices in 2017.
    • Now read LNG shipping: Demand-side macro outlook for April
     
     
     
     
    | 12:28 PM | 7 Comments
  • MTDR

    Matador Resources started at Outperform at Imperial Capital

    • Matador Resources (MTDR +3.4%) is initiated with an Outperform rating and $25 price target at Imperial Capital, which sees continued overall improvement in well results and costs as successful variations in design are implemented company-wide.
    • Based upon results of MTDR and nearby peers such as WPX Energy, the firm has increased confidence in Wolfcamp A wells at Wolf, for example, approaching or exceeding 1M barrels.
    • While MTDR does not have a rich liquidity cushion, its midstream assets could support readily available credit lines, while its Eagle Ford or Haynesville assets remain very attractive potential divestitures that could enhance liquidity, Imperial says.
    • Now read Matador Resources is a low-debt oil company
     
     
     
     
    | 11:59 AM
  • CMA

    Comerica on the move on rumor of sale

    • A number of sizable Comerica (CMA +2.4%) owners are urging for the bank to be sold, according to Dow Jones.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:48 AM | 1 Comment
  • BOCH

    Bank of Commerce reports Q1 results

    • Bank of Commerce (NASDAQ:BOCH): Q1 EPS of -$0.07
    • Revenue of $9.25M (+0.3% Y/Y)
    • Shares +1.45%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:04 AM
  • SBUX

    Starbucks says new rewards system will lead to higher profit

    • Starbucks (SBUX -5.6%) CEO Howard Schultz made it clear during the post-earnings conference call that the company's rewards program is still vibrant even with the new dollar-based system in play.
    • One million members were added during FQ2 to put the number of active My Starbucks Rewards members over 12M. Schultz noted that even last week after the loyalty change became effective, another 280K Reward members signed on.
    • During the call, CFO Scott Maw was asked about the impact of the rewards switch on financial results. Maw responded that there was no upfront tech investment and that the new program will be profitable immediately and build over time.
    • Starbucks earnings call transcript
    • Now read Starbucks Earnings: Don't Miss The Forest For The Trees
     
     
     
     
    | 10:54 AM | 52 Comments
  • SCWX

    SecureWorks, year's first tech IPO, opens trading

    • After pricing with lowered expectations last night, the first tech IPO of the year -- Dell unit SecureWorks (NASDAQ:SCWX) -- has opened for trading.
    • It opened a bit below debut price and dropped to a 2% decline, but is currently up 1.6% in choppy trade.
    • Yesterday evening, the company raised about $112M after it came in with a pricing at $14, below an expected range of $15.50-$17.50. It also sold 8M shares rather than a planned 9M.
    • Its coming-out ends the longest drought in tech IPOs in seven years.
    • Now read SecureWorks Prices First Tech IPO Of 2016 With A Fizzle »
     
     
     
     
    | 10:49 AM
  • BSM

    Black Stone Minerals to buy Freeport McMoRan energy assets for $102M

    • Black Stone Minerals (BSM +2.9%) agrees to acquire a package of oil and gas mineral assets from Freeport McMoRan (FCX +3%) for $102M, in a deal the company says will bolster its presence in the Permian region.
    • BSM says the assets include ~1.2M gross mineral acres, 16K net non-participating royalty interests and 11K overriding royalty interest acres in 20 states, concentrated in Texas, Louisiana and Arkansas.
    • The assets feature estimated Q4 production of 850 boe/day and estimated proved developed producing reserves of 2M boe as of Dec. 31.
    • Now read Black Stone Minerals LP IPO looks hot
     
     
     
     
    | 10:42 AM | 3 Comments
  • NGL

    NGL Energy Partners +30% after Oaktree investment

    • NGL Energy Partners (NGL +30.3%) surges at the open on heavy volume following news of a $200M investment from Oaktree Capital Management.
    • NGL calls Oaktree's investment "a strong endorsement of our business model, strategy and future growth projects," and says it plans to jointly pursue opportunities with Oaktree's help in financing and structuring.
    • NGL is higher even though it is cutting its quarterly distribution to $0.39/unit from $0.64/unit, which it expects to continue for three additional quarters under current market conditions; NGL says the reduction will save $170M on an annual basis to enhance liquidity, repay debt and/or invest in selected growth projects in the future.
    • Wunderlich's Jeff Birnbaum is concerned by NGL's reduced full-year guidance for adjusted EBITDA to $420M-$430M from $450M, which was given Feb. 9, nearly halfway through the current quarter.
    • NGL also says its Grand Mesa project is on schedule and projected capital costs are $20M under budget; crude oil shipments are expected to begin by Nov. 1.
    • Now read MLP bottom-fishing 7: NGL Energy Partners LP
     
     
     
     
    | 10:21 AM | 5 Comments
  • RIGL

    JP Morgan bullish on Rigel; shares up 8%

    • Micro cap Rigel Pharmaceuticals (RIGL +8.4%) bumps up on average volume in early trading. Earlier today, JP Morgan upgraded the company to Overweight while maintaining a $5 (83% upside) price target. Analyst Anupam Rama says two Phase 3 studies (#1 and #2) assessing lead product candidate fostamatinib in ideopathic thrombocytopenic purpura, an autoimmune disorder in which the body attacks and destroys blood platelets, have a high probability of success. Top-line data are expected mid-year.
    • Fostamatinib inhibits an enzyme called spleen tyrosine kinase (SYK) that plays a key role in certain blood cancers and autoimmune disorders.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:10 AM
  • GOOG

    Report: Microsoft, Google to drop regulatory complaints against each other

    • Tech peace in our time? Microsoft (MSFT -7.3%) and Google (GOOG -4.8%, GOOGL -5.3%) have agreed to drop the regulatory complaints they have against each other, on a global basis.
    • There's no product commitments in the deal, but it may help relieve headaches such as the one Google is facing with the EU's case against Android.
    • “Microsoft has agreed to withdraw its regulatory complaints against Google, reflecting our changing legal priorities,” that company tells Re/code.
    • Google: “Our companies compete vigorously, but we want to do so on the merits of our products, not in legal proceedings.”
    • Now read Alphabet: Sunk By Hidden Costs »
     
     
     
     
    | 9:57 AM | 10 Comments
  • SA

    Seabridge Gold in cross-border public offering, bought-deal financing

    • Seabridge Gold (SA -4%) opens lower after announcing a cross border public offering of common shares and a concurrent C$10.8M bought deal flow-through equity financing.
    • Underwriters agree to purchase on a bought deal basis 450K flow-through common shares at C$24.08 per flow-through share, with an option to purchase up to an additional 50K flow-through shares.
    • SA says gross proceeds from the offering will be used to fund its 2016 exploration program at the KSM project and, subject to completion of the acquisition of SnipGold, the Iskut property in northwestern British Columbia.
    • Now read Buy the explosive upside in this small exploration business now
     
     
     
     
    | 9:54 AM
  • AN

    'Biblical' hail dents profit at AutoNation

    • AutoNation (AN -0.8%) Mike Jackson kept his reputation intact as one of the more quotable CEOs during today's post-earnings chat with CNBC.
    • Jackson said "epic, biblical hail storms" in Texas during March contributed to the company's Q1 EPS shortfall, $0.90 reported vs. $0.93 consensus. The exec said that without the hail damage the company would have beat on the bottom line.
    • Now read Will Autos Be The Cyclical Trigger?
     
     
     
     
    | 9:37 AM
  • SRPT

    Investors not giving up on Sarepta; shares up 5% premarket

    • Sarepta Therapeutics (NASDAQ:SRPT) is up 5% premarket on increased volume as bargain hunters move in ahead of Monday's Ad Comm review of its eteplirsen NDA for Duchenne muscular dystrophy. Shares plummeted 44% yesterday in response to the FDA briefing material which questioned the drug's efficacy.
    • There is strong political support for approval, though, so bullish investors are hoping for an FDA override of a (probable) negative Ad Comm vote considering eteplirsen's benign safety profile. It's rare, but not unprecedented.
    • This is yet another example of the binary nature of biotech investing. Feast or famine. Monday will, undoubtedly, be an interesting day.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:18 AM | 21 Comments

  • Premarket Gainers / Losers as of 9:10 am

    • Gainers: AMD +26%. PARN +22%. NGL +16%. SKX +8%. NSC +7%. BCEI +6%. VRX +6%. PACB +5%.
    • Losers: TRXC -7%. EYES -7%. MSFT -6%. AAL -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:13 AM
  • KMB

    Kimberly-Clark -4% post Q1 results

    • Kimberly-Clark (NYSE:KMB) reports organic sales rose 2% in Q1, due to higher volumes.
    • Developing and emerging markets increased 5% for the period.
    • Foreign currency exchange rates negatively impacted revenue by 7%.
    • Segment revenue: Personal care: $2.207B (-4.4%); Consumer Tissue: $1.496B (-5%); K-C Professional: $763M (-4%).
    • Adjusted gross margin rate improved 100 bps to 36.6%.
    • Segment operating profit: Personal care: $449M (-1.3%); Consumer Tissue: $280M (-3.8%); K-C Professional: $150M (+11.9%).
    • Adjusted operating margin rate expanded 90 bps to 18.3%.
    • FY2016 Guidance: Organic sales growth: 3% to 5%; Tax rate: 30.5% to 32.5%; Adjusted EPS: $5.95 to $6.15; Diluted EPS: $5.89 to $6.12.
    • KMB -4.14% premarket.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:00 AM
  • GNTX

    More on Gentex's Q1

    • Gentex (NASDAQ:GNTX) reports Automotive net sales rose 9% to $394M in Q1, primarily due to 11% increase in auto-dimming mirror unit shipments.
    • Total auto-dimming mirror units +894 Y/Y to 8,827.
    • Dimmable aircraft window sales increased 42% and fire protection products +36% during the quarter.
    • Gross margin rate improved 30 bps to 39.1%.
    • Operating margin rate grew 60 bps to 29.8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:40 AM
  • PARNF

    Parnell Pharma Q1 sales up 43%; shares jump 17% premarket on light turnover

    • Thinly traded nano cap Parnell Pharmaceuticals Holdings (PARN) is up 17%  remarket, albeit on turnover of only 700 shares, in response to its announcement of Q1 results.
    • Highlights: total sales increased 43% yoy ($2.2M) and 10% sequentially driven by strong performance in the dairy reproduction business. Sales for Production Animal Rest-Of-World increased 83% yoy ($0.3M) driven primarily by the timing of orders from marketing partners.
    • Cash balance was $3.9M at the end of March.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:34 AM
  • MCD

    McDonald's beats by $0.07, beats on revenue

    • McDonald's (NYSE:MCD): Q1 EPS of $1.23 beats by $0.07.
    • Revenue of $5.9B (-1.0% Y/Y) beats by $80M.
    • Shares +1.72% PM.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:03 AM | 10 Comments
  • AN

    AutoNation lower post Q1 results

    • AutoNation (NYSE:AN) reports same-store sales fell 2% in Q1.
    • New vehicle revenue grew 1.1% to $2.8B for the quarter.
    • Used vehicle revenue increased 4.1% to $1.24B, led by 22.8% increase in wholesale revenue.
    • Segment revenue: Domestic: $1.85B (+11%); Import: $1.68B (-0.2%); Premium luxury: $1.54B (-1.5%).
    • Gross margin rate -10 bps to 16.1%.
    • Segment income: Domestic: $77.4M (-2.4%); Import: $76.1M (+1.5%); Premium Luxury: $83M (-11.8%).
    • Operating margin rate dropped 20 bps to 4.1%.
    • Retail new vehicle unit sales rose 0.6% Y/Y to 79,007.
    • AN -3.27% premarket.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:54 AM
  • V

    Visa lower after trimming FY16 guidance

    • Visa (NYSE:V) trades lower after issuing a forecast below expectations for FY16 as low gas prices dent consumer spending in some key markets.
    • Sales are seen rising 7% to 8% this fiscal year, below a prior outlook of a high single-digit to low double-digit range. The company expects profit growth in a low double-digit range, down from prior guidance for midteens growth.
    • Visa recorded payments volume growth of 12% to $1.3T in FQ2. Cross-border volume was up 5%. Total processed transactions were up 9% to 18.5B.
    • During the earnings call, CEO Charles Scharf said trends in April are unchanged.
    • Visa -3.29% premarket to $78.13.
    • Now read the Visa earnings call transcript 
     
     
     
     
    | 7:41 AM | 3 Comments
  • EYES

    Second Sight files for ~$20M equity offering; shares down 9% premarket

    • Second Sight Medical (NASDAQ:EYES) eases 9% premarket on light volume in response to its S-1 filing for a 10M-share equity offering, priced at a 15% discount versus an unspecified closing price or $4.25. Current stockholders will have the opportunity to buy additional shares via non-tradable $0.55/share subscription rights.
    • Yesterday's close was $5.37.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:38 AM | 1 Comment
  • WBC

    More on WABCO Holdings' Q1

    • WABCO Holdings (NYSE:WBC) reports sales rose 9.7% in local currencies.
    • Adjusted gross profit rate fell 170 bps to 31.4%.
    • SG&A expense rate declined 130 bps to 17.5%.
    • Adjusted operating margin rate dropped 40 bps to 13.9%.
    • FY2016 Guidance: Sales growth: $2.7B to $2.83B (+6% to +11% in local currencies); Adjusted operating margin rate: 13.8% to 14.3%; GAAP operating margin rate: 12.7% to 13.2%; Adjusted net income: $296.8M to $324.8M; GAAP net income: $192.2M to $220.2M; Adjusted EPS: $5.30 to $5.80; Diluted EPS: $3.43 to $3.93; Diluted shares outstanding: ~56M.
    • Q1 results
     
     
     
     
    | 6:56 AM
